alert.note: Alert for Jones; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 8:47PM CDT until May 12 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Jones County in west central Texas... Northeastern Taylor County in west central Texas... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 846 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Abilene. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Abilene, Tye, Dyess Afb, Hamby and Impact. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 276 and 292. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Curry Lane from Clack Street to Catclaw Drive, Texas Avenue at Arnold Boulevard, Butternut Underpass, Intersections along Sammons Street, South 27th Street at Catclaw Creek, 2000 block of Oak Street, Intersections along South 25th Street, Intersections along Vogel Street, FM 3308 crossing Draw and North 6th Street and Willis. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
